top_categories.workout_context: Gravel Roubaix’s pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Gravel Roubaix isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Gravel Roubaix rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gravel Roubaix when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 100 miles, Gravel Roubaix punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Roubaix. Make this intensity feel like home.

Gravel Roubaix’s pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gravel Roubaix — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Gravel Roubaix’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gravel Roubaix — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads.
Every session at Gravel Roubaix intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.

Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Gravel Roubaix’s pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel Roubaix’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Gravel Roubaix. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Gravel Roubaix demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 100 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 100 miles of pocono mountain gravel roads - steep sustained climbs, technical rocky descents, remote forest roads in Palmerton, Pennsylvania.
